{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Radiolucent stones are those that do not show up on a standard X-ray because they are not dense enough to block the X-rays. Xanthine stones are radiolucent because xanthine is not dense enough. Allopurinol is a medication used to treat gout and certain types of kidney stones, it does not form stones. Orotic acid stones are also radiolucent. However, Cysteine stones are radiopaque, meaning they do show up on an X-ray because they are dense enough to block the X-rays.", "answer_choice": "B. Cysteine" }
